hero.headline: It's a love story. Just say yes.
hero.subheadline: Because love is patient, love is kind, and also… we already paid the deposit. So please RSVP ASAP before we elope out of sheer stress.

howWeMet.title: How We Met
howWeMet.description: We first crossed paths at a mutual friend's birthday party. What started as a casual conversation about our shared love for travel turned into hours of talking and laughing. We exchanged numbers that night, and the rest, as they say, is history.

firstDate.title: Our First Date
firstDate.description: For our first date, we went to a small Italian restaurant downtown. We talked for hours over pasta and wine, losing track of time completely. The waiter had to politely let us know they were closing!

proposal.title: The Proposal
proposal.description: On Christmas Eve, during a trip to the mountains, we went for a sunset hike to a beautiful overlook. As the sky turned pink and gold, I got down on one knee and asked the most important question of my life. And she said yes!

sections.text: You made it! Whether you received your invite via pigeon, post, or a guilt-trip — we're thrilled you're here.
We can't wait to celebrate this gloriously chaotic and love-filled day with you.
This site has all the need-to-knows: where to be, what to wear, how to get there, and where to sleep it off.
We're beyond excited to make memories (and mild mistakes) together in beautiful England.

venue.title: Venue
venue.description: Arrive early, caffeinate accordingly. Join us from 12:00 for a pre-ceremony warm-up featuring teas, coffees, and possibly some nervous pacing. The main event (aka the ceremony) kicks off at 13:00 — followed by drinks, snacks, and some heartfelt hugs (or awkward reunions, your call).

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.disclaimer: Disclaimer: Times may shift slightly. We'll be on "wedding time."

items.event: Arrival party, tea, coffee & pre-wedding people-watching
Please take your seats (no musical chairs, sorry)
The main event: us saying "I do"
Cocktail hour, mingling, and sneaky selfies
Food hall opens, speeches, and dramatic entrances
The feast (bring stretchy pants… just kidding. Kind of.)
Live band, bar, and questionable dance moves

attire.title: Attire
attire.note:
Dress Code: Semi-Formal / Cocktail – aka "look fab but stay comfy"

Bonus Tip: January in the UK = chilly. The venue will be toasty, but layer up for the journey.

women.title: For Women
guidelines: Midi, knee-length, or floor-length dresses welcome. Chic suits and polished combos also great.
Footwear: Heels, fancy flats, or sandals that won't betray you on the dance floor.
women.note: PSA: Please save white, cream, or ivory for the bridal spreadsheet.

men.title: For Men
guidelines: Neutral suits, crisp dress shirts, and a tie or bow tie (optional, but highly encouraged).

accommodation.title: Accommodation
accommodation.description: Davenport House has space for up to 40 guests in beautifully cozy rooms and cottages. We've reserved these at a discounted rate for our guests, with priority for those flying internationally, immediate family, and the wedding squad.

alternatives.title: Prefer your own adventure?
options: Or check out local Airbnbs for some extra freedom — just don't forget your toothbrush. If you need help booking, we're only a message away.

travel.title: Travel
travel.intro: Flying in from abroad? You absolute legends. Thank you for making the journey — we recommend arriving a few days early to beat jet lag and figure out the kettle.
options: Birmingham (BHX) — 45 mins by car to Worfield
Train option: Birmingham New Street → Wolverhampton → taxi to venue

alternatives.title: Flying into London Heathrow? (Solid choice.)
options: Or hop on a train to Wolverhampton, then taxi it the rest of the way

travel.tip: Pro tip: pack snacks for the road.

travelSpots.title: Travel Spots
travelSpots.intro: Landing early? Make a mini-holiday of it! While you wait to witness our vows, explore London like a local tourist:
spots: Natural History Museum – Free, massive, and has dinosaurs.
Hyde Park – Stroll, sip, and ponder life near a swan.
Covent Garden – Ideal for tea, theatre, and street performers who may or may not be better dancers than us.

gifts.title: Gifts
gifts.description: Your presence is truly the best gift. But if you're feeling generous (or just really bad at showing up empty-handed), a contribution towards our future together would mean the world. We're keeping it light and luggage-free, so no physical gifts please — we've only got so many suitcases and most of them are full of wedding stress.
